text.section:
Except as provided in this section for an action against any health care professional under § 7-316 of this subtitle, any person aggrieved by a final decision of the Board in a contested case, as defined in the Administrative Procedure Act, may:
Appeal that decision to the Board of Review; and
Then take any further appeal allowed by the Administrative Procedure Act.

section.section: Any health care professional aggrieved by a final decision of the Board under § 7-316 of this subtitle may not appeal to the Secretary or Board of Review but may take a direct judicial appeal.
The appeal shall be made as provided for judicial review of final decisions in the Administrative Procedure Act.

text.section: If a person notes an appeal from an order of suspension or revocation by the Board, the order is stayed.
